Description: Blue glazed composition amulet in the form of a fly with the head of a hawk wearing the sun-disc(?); wedjat-eye across the wings; pierced transversely.
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.41

Published: C. Andrews, 'The Boar, the Ram-Headed Crocodile and the Lunar Fly' in W. V. Davies (ed), Studies in Egyptian Antiquities: A Tribute to T. G. H. James (BM Occasional Paper 123, 1999), 79-81.
